register.description: The control register configures the Display Controller module for the VP output. Shadow register.

bitfield.description: Determines the position of the COLORCONV module
Color Space Conversion full range setting
Enable the color space conversion. The coefficients and offsets used are all programmable and controlled by CPR_COEFF_* and CPR_OFFSET_* registers
Selects the first field to output in case of interlace mode. In case of progressive mode, the value is not used
Selects between progressive and interlace mode for the VP output
Selects BT-1120 format on the VP output. It is not possible to enable BT656 and BT1120 at the same time one the same LCD output
Selects BT-656 format on the VP output. It is not possible to enable BT656 and BT1120 at the same time one the same LCD output
Write 0's for future compatibility Reads return 0
Deprecated. Always write 0
Deprecated. Always write 0
Write 0's for future compatibility Reads return 0
Deprecated. Always write 0
VSYNC Gated Enabled [VP output]. Shadow bit-field
HSYNC Gated Enabled [VP output]. Shadow bit-field
Pixel Clock Gated Enabled [VP output]. Shadow bit-field
Pixel Data Gated Enabled [VP output]. Shadow bit-field
Deprecated. Always write 0
Enable the gamma Shadow bit-field
DE Gated Enable Shadow bit-field
Pixel Gated Enable. Shadow bit-field

register.description: The control register configures the Display Controller module for the VP output

bitfield.description: Spatial/Temporal dithering number of frames for the VP output Shadow bit-field
Write 0's for future compatibility Reads return 0
State of unused bits [TDM mode only] for the VP output Shadow bit-field
Cycle format [TDM mode only] for the VP output Shadow bit-field
Output Interface width [TDM mode only] for the VP output Shadow bit-field
Enable the multiple cycle format for the VP output Shadow bit-field
Hold Time for output. Shadow bit-field. Encoded value [from 1 to 8] to specify the number of external digital clock periods to hold the data [programmed value = value minus one]
Deprecated. Always write 0
Width of the data bus on VP output Shadow bit-field
Spatial Temporal dithering enable for the VP output Shadow bit-field
Enable the DPI output. wr:immediate
GO Command for the VP output. It is used to synchronize the pipelines associated with the VP output wr:immediate
Deprecated. Always write 0
Deprecated. Always write 0
Deprecated. Always write 0
Enable the modulo of the line number interrupt generation
Enable the video port output. wr:immediate

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
C01 Coefficient. Encoded signed value [from -1024 to 1023]
Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
C00 Coefficient. Encoded signed value [from -1024 to 1023]

C11 Coefficient. Encoded signed value [from -1024 to 1023]

register.description: The control register configures the output data format over up to 3 cycles. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility Reads return 0
Bit alignment Alignment of the bits from pixel 2 on the output interface
Write 0's for future compatibility Reads return 0
Number of bits Number of bits from the pixel 2 [value from 0 to 16 bits]. The values from 17 to 31 are invalid
Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
Bit alignment Alignment of the bits from pixel 1 on the output interface
Write 0's for future compatibility Reads return 0
Number of bits Number of bits from the pixel 1 [value from 0 to 16 bits]. The values from 17 to 31 are invalid

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility Reads return 0
Bit alignment Alignment of the bits from pixel 2 on the output interface

Number of bits Number of bits from the pixel 2 [value from 0 to 16 bits]. The values from 17 to 31 are invalid
Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
Bit alignment Alignment of the bits from pixel 1 on the output interface
Write 0's for future compatibility Reads return 0
Number of bits Number of bits from the pixel 1 [value from 0 to 16 bits]. The values from 17 to 31 are invalid

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility Reads return 0
Bit alignment Alignment of the bits from pixel 2 on the output interface
Write 0's for future compatibility Reads return 0

register.description: The control register indicates the panel display line number for the interrupt and the DMA request. Shadow register

bitfield.description: LCD panel line number programming LCD line number defines the line on which the programmable interrupt is generated and the DMA request occurs

register.description: The register configures the signal configuration. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility Reads return 0
Defines the alignment between HSYNC and VSYNC assertion
HSYNC/VSYNC Pixel clock Control On/Off
Program HSYNC/VSYNC Rise or Fall
Invert output enable
Invert pixel clock
Invert HSYNC
Invert VSYNC
AC Bias Pin transitions per interrupt Value [from 0 to 15] used to specify the number of AC Bias pin transitions

AC Bias Pin Frequency Value [from 0 to 255] used to specify the number of line clocks to count before transitioning the AC Bias pin. This pin is used to periodically invert the polarity of the power supply to prevent DC charge build-up within the display

register.description: The register configures the panel size horizontal and vertical. Shadow register. A delta value is used to indicate if the odd field has same vertical size as the even field or +/- one line.

bitfield.description: Lines per panel Encoded value [from 1 to 4096] to specify the number of lines per panel [program to value minus one]
Indicates the delta size value of the odd field compared to the even field

Pixels per line Encoded value [from 1 to 4096] to specify the number of pixels contains within each line on the display [program to value minus one]. In STALL mode, any value is valid In non-STALL mode, only values multiple of 8 pixels are valid

register.description: The register configures the timing logic for the HSYNC signal. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Horizontal Back Porch Encoded value [from 1 to 4096] to specify the number of pixel clock periods to add to the beginning of a line transmission before the first set of pixels is output to the display [program to value minus one] When in BT mode and interlaced, this field corresponds to the vertical field blanking No 2 for Even Field

Horizontal front porch Encoded value [from 1 to 4096] to specify the number of pixel clock periods to add to the end of a line transmission before line clock is asserted display [program to value minus one] When in BT mode and interlaced, this field corresponds to the vertical field blanking No 1 for Even Field

Horizontal synchronization pulse width Encoded value [from 1 to 256] to specify the number of pixel clock periods to pulse the line clock at the end of each line display [program to value minus one] When in BT mode, this field corresponds to the LSB 8-bits of the 12-bit horizontal blanking[BT_HBLANK[11:0]= {VSW[3:0],HSW[7:0]}]

register.description: The register configures the timing logic for the VSYNC signal. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Vertical back porch Encoded value [from 0 to 4095] to specify the number of line clock periods to add to the beginning of a frame When in BT mode and interlaced, this field corresponds to the vertical field blanking No 2 for Odd Field When in BT and in progressive mode, this field corresponds to the Vertical frame blanking No 2 before the first set of pixels is output to the display

Vertical front porch Encoded value [from 0 to 4095] to specify the number of line clock periods to add to the end of each frame When in BT mode and interlaced, this field corresponds to the vertical field blanking No 1 for Odd Field When in BT and in progressive mode, this field corresponds to the Vertical frame blanking No 2

Vertical synchronization pulse width Encoded value [from 1 to 256] to specify the number of line clock periods to pulse the frame clock [VSYNC] pin at the end of each frame after the end of frame wait [VFP] period elapses Frame clock uses as VSYNC signal in active mode When in BT mode, the lsb 4-bits of this field [VSW[3:0]] corresponds to the MSB 4-bits of the 12-bit horizontal blanking[BT_HBLANK= {VSW[3:0],HSW[7:0]}]

register.description: The register configures the color space conversion matrix coefficients. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
C21 coefficient. Encoded signed value [from -1024 to 1023]
Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
C20 coefficient. Encoded signed value [from -1024 to 1023]

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0

bitfield.description: Row-2 pre-offset. Encoded signed value [from -4096 to 4095]

register.description: The register configures the safety sub-region n. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Indicates which frames to be skipped while doing FRAMEFREEZE or DATACHECK [Useful for interlaced displays]. 0x0: No frames are skipped, 0x1: Even Frames are skipped starting from second frame after ENABLE, 0x2: Odd Frames are skipped starting from first frame after ENABLE, 0x3: Reserved

Allowed maximum number of frames with the same frame signature When the freeze frame counter reaches 1 over this value [freeze_frame_thold+1], a freeze frame detection will occur Note: The freeze frame counter is cleared on reset -OR- MISR not enabled -OR- terminal count reached -OR- compare == no match
Initial seed selection control
Mode of operation of the safety check module
Safety check Enable for the region Note: Transition from 0 to 1 clears the signature register

register.description: The register configures the safety sub-region n. Shadow register

bitfield.description: Indicates which frames to be skipped while doing FRAMEFREEZE or DATACHECK [Useful for interlaced displays]. 0x0: No frames are skipped, 0x1: Even Frames are skipped starting from second frame after ENABLE, 0x2: Odd Frames are skipped starting from first frame after ENABLE, 0x3: Reserved

Allowed maximum number of frames with the same frame signature When the freeze frame counter reaches 1 over this value [freeze_frame_thold+1], a freeze frame detection will occur Note: The freeze frame counter is cleared on reset -OR- MISR not enabled -OR- terminal count reached -OR- compare == no match
Initial seed selection control
Mode of operation of the safety check module
Safety check Enable for the region Note: Transition from 0 to 1 clears the signature register

bitfield.description: Y position of the safety sub-region n. Encoded value [from 0 to 4095] to specify the Y position of the sub-region on the screen The first line on the top of the screen has the Y-position 0

register.description: This register configures the OLDI[N:0] modules connected to the DSS

bitfield.description: Test pattern Config
SoftWare Reset. By default, OLDI is kept under reset
DualMode Sync
LoopBack Data
LoopBack Enable
DSS bit-depth [for 18b LVDS only]
Polarity of the DE signal
Master selection in Dual mode only [typically tied off in the SoC]
Single mode or duplicate mode
Source Channel
Configuration of OLDI mapping Also indicates dual mode
OLDI Enable

register.description: This register captures the PID from the OLDI[N:0] modules connected to the DSS. Reads 0x0 if no OLDI is connected

bitfield.description: Module ID Field
RTL Revision
Major Revision
Minor Revision

register.description: This register captures the Loopback data from OLDI

bitfield.description: Returned Data from Loopback
